snippet.title: All puns intended ... Kathy Lette is coming to the Canberra Writers Festival
snippet.content:
Photo: Neale Haynes. She's part of Australian publishing royalty, stretching all the way back to Puberty Blues and encompassing 11 international bestsellers. And she never met a pun she didn't like. Let's also not forget she's best mates with George and Amal Clooney.Photo: Peter Mathew Kathy Lette is one of the stars of this year's Canberra Writers Festival which is on August 25 to 27. It's theme this year is Power, Politics, Passion. Lette will be appearing at three events in Canberra as part of the festival. She'll be speaking at a Women in Media event at the National Press Club on Friday, August 25.
Lette also promises to take the audience from "Puberty Blues to Menopause Blues" at a speaking event at the National Library of Australia at 2pm on Saturday, August 26.

There will be "tales of love, lust, men, marriage, pregnancy, childbirth, ageing, toy boys and adventures with the Royal Family, George Clooney and Julian Assange". {Her estranged husband, QC Geoffrey Robertson was lawyer Amal's boss.) Then there is the closing event of the festival: where she will be joined by fellow writers Maggie Alderson, Jamila Rizvi and Jane Caro for a no-holds-barred discussion. That will be held at 7pm on Sunday, August 27 at Llewellyn Hall, Australian National University. But these sassy women are just the start of what promises to be a lively festival. The opening night dinner will be with chef, farmer and former Canberran Matthew Evans at the National Portrait Gallery on Thursday, August 24. Other writers to attend the festival include Chris Masters, Gareth Evans, Hugh Mackay, Jean Kittson, Jon Safran, Nikki Gemmell, Richard Fidler and Tracey Spicer. For more details on the program and to book for events go to http://www.canberrawritersfestival.com.au/
